title: Isco 'has accepted he will leave Real Madrid'... with Manchester City and Arsenal interested
text:
Real Madrid midfielder Isco has reportedly accepted that he will be leaving the club in January and is looking to secure a move to the Premier League.

Isco has been restricted to just 170 minutes of La Liga action so far this season and also struggled for regular minutes at times last season.

As reported by AS, Manchester City and Arsenal are both interested in signing the Spain international.

Isco has reportedly accepted that he will leave Real Madrid in the January transfer window

Arsenal, who have struggled for creativity at times this season, would certainly benefit from having a player of Isco's calibre at their disposal.

Despite Isco's contract at Real running until the summer of 2022, the 27-year-old could soon depart as he seeks regular playing time.

Manchester City and Arsenal are amongst the clubs that have been linked with the midfielder

Real reportedly remain interested in signing Christian Eriksen from Tottenham, and the arrival of the Denmark international would push Isco further down the pecking order at The Bernabeu.

Capable of playing as an attacking midfielder or out wide, Isco has scored 48 goals and provided 52 assists since joining Real from Malaga in 2013.

During his time at Real, Isco has won an array of trophies, including four Champions Leagues, the La Liga title and the Copa del Rey.
